verbose_text: [XREF_BIBR] Quinolinic acid has been shown to produce a wide variety of toxic effects in the brain, such as depletion of GABA, excessive increases in cytosolic Ca 2+ concentration, ATP exhaustion, neuronal oxidative stress, and cell death, [XREF_BIBR - XREF_BIBR] Quinolinic acid toxicity can also result in caspase-3-like activation and DNA fragmentation.
